93A1216D9DEE4163AD08F8762F8AC464.description: Listen to and consider feedback given.

E23D5C0B81624BA9BB396809F6F8EBE2.description: Attempt new strategies and determine what strategies are effective.

13A24D557199453DB43E7C859A94788D.description: Explain new strategies to peers and teacher.

26A11F59C95B4642A8936B0D31752B20.description: Identify viewing, listening, emerging “reading”, speaking, emerging “writing”, and other representing strategies.

37872AF3E4F54386A92D2FFB473275DC.description: Reflect and talk about new learning.

64925B89B6384A90984A4365F1A1CEB1.description: Listen to and consider feedback given.

1BAAE3EF2FEB4C3C972F19E87F1F674D.description: Attempt new strategies and determine what strategies are effective.

E26CCE993AE14FF1950FCE953D0C27E0.description: Explain new strategies to peers and teacher.

ED05C0FD8DF54329BD7F214E0173F556.description: Identify viewing, listening, emerging “reading”, speaking, emerging “writing”, and other representing strategies.

A451FA28D27E433D963E6762748C5C83.description: Reflect on viewing, listening, emerging “reading”, representing, speaking, and emerging “writing” experiences in the context of teacher-led discussions.

6D424403BD28435FAA738BC0B9346EB1.description: Assess and Reflect (AR). Children will assess their own language skills; discuss the skills of effective viewers, representers, listeners, speakers, readers, and writers; and set goals for future improvement.

6C33769E29094DA09A8A5A9011E6E52C.description: Dictate a story based on a representation that needs to be explained in writing.

33E0007D50B847F08B6A27200F74B1C6.description: Tell others about the intended meaning of drawings and writings.

50516A5CF4A34BAA82197EE70165C337.description: Write as part of play (e.g., grocery list, parking tickets, menu, signs)

CD91099538E04BF8A5AA9FF712CD0679.description: Share experiences, feelings, and thoughts with a scribe.

2C868E571B2E41328ABDF39CCE10F3C5.description: Attempt to copy letters or words from the environment (e.g., books, chart paper poems, word wall, name cards, public signs) to express ideas or understanding.

C1995C115B234DF3A199C3620F442567.description: Use language cues and conventions to construct and communicate meaning when “writing”: use and apply the different functions of language (pragmatic), tell or dramatize stories using own words and appropriate gestures (textual), use different sentence patterns (syntactic), manipulate sounds and words in shared, guided, and independent activities (lexical/semantic), explore sounds and rhymes (graphophonic), and use various tools and techniques to represent ideas (other cues and conventions).

BB55AC2BAD4A49B29F1D2E5918547994.description: Use the appropriate strategies to communicate meaning when “writing”: find ideas to explore (before), tell story about self (during), and add detail (after).

96D915ED2E90417EBC7835D1B775DE27.description: Experiment with drawing, scribbling, letters, and temporary spelling to convey ideas.

7195CB98CC7C4478B94DF28585269A21.description: Create messages using a combination of pictures, symbols, and letters.

50BB1DBF500446EBB7F823BB3E4A8983.description: Converse on personal experiences, preferences, and topics of interest: talk to peers about likes and dislikes, express interest in different topics, share significant items from home and community, relate events to teacher, initiate conversations, ask politely to borrow something, take part in group activities such as circle or story time, share stories in large or small groups, and share poems, rhymes, songs, and finger plays.

EB9E95235FE7456AA40F50B5329063EF.description: Use language cues and conventions to construct and communicate meaning when speaking: use and apply the different functions of language (pragmatic), tell or dramatize stories using own words and appropriate gestures (textual), use different sentence patterns (syntactic), manipulate sounds and words in shared, guided, and independent activities (lexical/semantic), explore sounds and rhymes (graphophonic), use various tools and techniques to represent ideas (other cues and conventions).

BE45E703D49F41D8AF28DEB7B347BD0C.description: Use the appropriate strategies to communicate meaning when speaking: find ideas to explore (before), tell a story about self (during), and add detail (after)

09B67759C74F457D83CB885162C249CB.description: Use oral language to engage in exploratory and imaginative play: create play situations, interpret peer’s response to ideas, explain idea for play, play co-operatively with other children, and express suggestions given by playmate.

327C3610340348BB9B62392A21EB5A6E.description: Use oral language to converse, engage in play, express ideas, and share personal experiences.

62611C5AC8324F4593638B1FA4DED92C.description: Represent stories through pictures, dictation, physical movement, and play and describe/explain their symbols, pictures, and dramatizations

CFB7ABEB9329407CBE8CD49A9A78CF8D.description: Interpret characters through drawing, talking, play, and drama.

461D9FE2A0CD4439ADAFA9A38A24873D.description: Express ideas and feelings using wood, blocks, clay, and natural materials.

A04F2C9BE06A403A9040915422900791.description: Demonstrate knowledge of upper and lower case letters; show awareness of the first place position of a capital letter in words; notice the use of punctuation marks and try them out in own communication.

6073B823FC384772B7AAE17BA3EAEE63.description: Create a story about self and family.

B2636D2923734DDF8651CE41591D5D9F.description: Combine words and images to make meaning.

632F331582AC4643BF03B1AB6F8BA951.description: Use language cues and conventions to construct and communicate meaning: use and apply the different functions of language (pragmatic), tell or dramatize a story using own words and appropriate gestures (pragmatic), use different sentence patterns (syntactic), and manipulate sounds and words in shared, guided, and independent activities (lexical/semantic), explore sounds and rhymes (graphophonic), anduse various tools and techniques to represent ideas (other cues and conventions).

A518F2EED253438AB4842877679D4921.description: Use the appropriate strategies to communicate meaning: find ideas to explore (before), tell a story about self (during), and add detail (after).

DE3B36B5A7CF41088DE363CDD67D4CE5.description: Use imagination to communicate when appropriate.

3C1BDE1145914C6F8D1420407ABBBB30.description: Use and construct symbols, pictures, and dramatizations to communicate feelings and ideas in a variety of ways.

7BF1950D958E4ACCBB1DCA884A7B2C49.description: Explore ideas and information to make sense of experiences.

BF975FD4C26C430EB939DFAD8334E570.description: Share information and ideas with a group.

293E8FE335F04C2DB54B013B2A6E1C73.description: Compose and create a variety of texts that address identity (e.g., exploring interests), community (e.g., belonging), and social responsibility (e.g., contributing).

BBEE9541F1A741E5AB5A068C9B859E5F.description: Compose and create various visual, multimedia, oral, and written texts that explore and present thoughts, ideas, and experiences.

9577CAF5959C4704AE9DB759A24AFAC3.description: Compose and Create (CC) - Children will extend their abilities to speak, write, and use other forms of representation to explore and present thoughts, feelings, and experiences in a variety of forms for a variety of purposes and audiences.

B5D8CF1701E541D38D102809C7281EDC.description: Relate personal experiences, and represent responses through drama, physical movement, music, drawings, and models

DF09F3650D81471FAE9595345CAA91D1.description: Create play situations from basic understandings of story text.

2E875F7D7FDB4B22BCDBB5E9A34BDB51.description: Demonstrate an awareness that print is a permanent way of recording ideas.

F5D538BE794E4DA99282F3B258C37B05.description: Choose to read or look at books, and demonstrate knowledge of print, reading-like behaviours, and book-handling skills.

DA8DA21699D946879427D68CDD65625B.description: Know where to look for the title and author/illustrator

31E250E0BD6E4A47A0AE951A24EB184F.description: Demonstrate an interest in and knowledge about books and reading.

554EEB64013D4EEB8A9B4C645A26DB0C.description: Understand and apply language cues and conventions to construct and confirm meaning when viewing, listening, and “reading”: recognize the variations of language use at home, on the playground, and in the classroom (pragmatic), describe characteristics of fiction texts (textual), develop a sense of sentence (syntactic), show curiosity in words and their sounds (lexical/semantic), develop phonological awareness (graphophonic),and recognize how gestures and body language communicate part of the message (other cues and conventions).

115B6DFA4FBA47989253FFC091EC4FB0.description: Use strategies to construct and confirm meaning when “reading”: make connections to background knowledge (before), identify important ideas and events (during), and recall (after).

5DBF79B10D0146BDB0A2310421267B84.description: Comprehend, retell, and respond to basic ideas in stories, poems, songs, and informational texts read to them.

4EE569B3D5A14E00BA0EEFF2048EC51B.description: Engage in conversations with others in an exchange of ideas, comments, or questions.

43B9CE9A634F42B5BEE8F6A5C94A8392.description: Connect story events and own experience.

C72F438700484712952E1356999EE7A1.description: Ask questions for clarification, and make comments relevant to the topic.

F9F7F453AAC347CA9135555A4C76A488.description: Listen for different purposes (e.g., to retell, to direct others, for enjoyment).

29304F0EFB754150AD776CB765EE91A9.description: Listen to traditional and contemporary stories from a variety of cultures including First Nations and Métis.

07013A7D54004BEB9924BD9E8E33CFDF.description: Follow simple directions correctly and independently (e.g., Please put away your crayons and put your picture on the shelf.) and remember instructions given earlier.

B904EA961C874CB191607FD72E48A6D1.description: Understand and apply language cues and conventions to construct and confirm meaning when listening: recognize the variations of language use at home, on the playground, and in the classroom (pragmatic), describe characteristics of fiction texts (textual), develop a sense of sentence (syntactic), show curiosity in words and their sounds (lexical/semantic), develop phonological awareness (graphophonic), and recognize how gestures and body language communicate part of the message (other cues and conventions).

2FA2A4D80A27460DB0A35FF5B8C39829.description: Use strategies to construct and confirm meaning when listening: make connections to background knowledge (before), identify important ideas and events (during), and recall (after).

A43E50F15C8B4F0982C09D74928DF322.description: Listen attentively to others and respond appropriately.

21458CA3A4B448EDBC2FC1917643B017.description: Listen, comprehend, and respond to gain meaning in oral texts.

62979E30CDCB419FA6CDA4B517E000F8.description: View and interpret key aspects including arrangement and facial expression by interpreting the following questions: What are the objects or facts in the picture?,  What do the objects or facts tell you?, How are the objects arranged in the visual?, Why are these objects placed in this way?, How do the objects help the story or fact?, What are the characters doing?, and Compare different authors/illustrations considering the illustration or art work and interesting details.

6B0AEE4856DE4F449D04DDE0E64D4BDA.description: Describe the visual texts and give reasons for liking/disliking them.

C29DCDE64A6D4EAD8C05BCC39C4E4825.description: Interpret emotions portrayed in visual texts including models, photographs, dramas, dance creations, and video programs.

FD2A1ABDDBA14BA8A250375A4AD4D657.description: Compare similarities and differences such as colour, type of visual, and object placement between various texts such as pictures, photographs, and 3-D models.

FF164FCB448A42D9AA13F2E7BD724E99.description: Volunteer personal experiences and feelings prompted by various visuals.

A56CF3E956F84CFD85F05929393C7592.description: Understand and apply language cues and conventions to construct and confirm meaning when viewing:, recognize the variations of language use at home, on the playground, and in the classroom (pragmatic), describe characteristics of fiction texts (textual), develop a sense of sentence (syntactic), show curiosity in words and their sounds (lexical/semantic), develop phonological awareness (graphophonic), and recognize how gestures and body language communicate part of the message (other cues and conventions).

319EC1343AB349EA92BC09576A906C71.description: Use strategies to construct and confirm meaning when viewing: make connections to background knowledge (before), identify important ideas and events (during), and recall (after).

9451B160D92C4B3794EB3C9F6E362CDF.description: Identify key idea(s) and purpose of pictures, graphics, models, and photographs.

3E64E4E6F10143AC8738738C6EC20DF2.description: View and interpret the basic message of visuals and objects in a variety of texts including models, photographs, dramas, dance creations, and videos.

D68CC44330204D4F87E3FDB6C7C08206.description: Satisfy natural curiosity by engaging in inquiry: wonder about new ideas and observations, discuss personal knowledge of a topic, ask questions to satisfy personal curiosity and information needs, identify self and others as sources of information, seek information from others including people at school, at home, and in the community including Elders and Knowledge Keepers, compare gathered ideas and information to personal knowledge, share learning and information-gathering experiences, compose with a scribe, and indicate whether or not information is useful for answering questions.

8188CA9A7F8448769B0815FD1045FE53.description: Relate a personal experience as a result of a picture, photograph, or model.

FF27C174F2EB49838408851AB2155E79.description: Use illustrations, photographs, video programs, objects, and auditory cues to understand ideas and information

7856B82455A646EF9D76D1D1E6F3B431.description: Relate aspects of stories and information to personal feelings and experiences

58759A4C861B45F9B01893EEBED855D5.description: Share personal experiences and family traditions related to texts.

DCBF3B96027F4B12A4A27EC76898CEF8.description: Make connections among oral language and personal experiences.

77F7ACBADA6140DB9539E2B6398344CF.description: View, listen to, comprehend, and respond to a variety of texts (including First Nations and Métis resources) that address identity

777E236129E040888F4F7F1F37025379.description: Comprehend and respond to a variety of visual, oral, print, and multimedia texts that address identity (e.g., exploring interests), community (e.g., belonging), and social responsibility (e.g., contributing).

D0EBEA72BE7D4A299B91FF0B3ECE17EE.description: Comprehend and Respond (CR) - Children will extend their abilities to view, listen to, read, comprehend, and respond to a range of contemporary and traditional grade-level texts in a variety of forms (oral, print, and other texts) from First Nations/Métis, and other cultures for a variety of purposes including for learning, interest, and enjoyment
